August, 1948 E : 14.20 houis, 2nd August, 1948o IMMEDIATE Ho. 867* Following from Air Adviser for Prodrome Tehran* 1 ® One Anson aircraft on deliver^' to Afghanistan is reported Toy R.A»F* Staging Post Mauripur (Karachi) to he detained at Chahhar with crew or two and 4 passengers 0 2* This aircraft broke its Journey to Mauripur at Jiwani and has beer, plying between Jiwani and Chahbar salvaging as much as possible of another Anson aircraft on similar flight which crash landed.at Chahbar on June 7the 3« It is understood from Captain of a third Anson aircraft which arrived here that before aircraft left U«Ko approval for salvage operations had been received from Persian authorities by British Aviation Services which is ferrying agency. 4» Identity of passengers unknown at present but thought to be ground crew to assist in salvage work© 5a Grateful for any assistance Teheran Embassy can give to ensure early release of detained personnel and aircraft. ^ v Lca* 1/ tr\kC> • . 2. kv- -A A'This is an unparapnrased version of a Secret cypher (typex) message and the text must first be paraphrased if it is essential to communicate it to persons outside British and United states Government Services. Inward Telegram to Commonwealth Relations'■Office ALLOTTED TO POLITICAL DEPARTMENT CYPHER (TYPEX) * t ^ \ .FROM; U.K. HIGH COMISSIONER IN F>vKISTi*N. D. Ki-ELtCHI, 4*25 p.m. 17th July, 1948* R* 3«36 p.m* 17th July, 1948, IMPORTANT UNNUMBERED : t cu, uj % r* 4- Is ^ 4 ^ _ L _ -r-> __ 6 JUL IWo please pass the following Message to Prodrome Bahrein No. 166 MISC. Following information received from R.^.F. staging post Mauripur. Three Prentice aircraft, being ferried to India by British crews, were detained by Persian Military authorities at Jask on 14th July, and are believed to be still there. Crews have reported by radio telephony that food and water are unsatisfactory. R.^.F. staging post are signalling air traffi control centre Habbaniya (?Hablaniya). COPY TO: F.O. Office for retransmission Bahrein.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Pol Ext 16666/48 'Retention of British air crews in Persia'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Thefile contains papers regarding the detention of British aircraft in Persia.Folio 5 refers to the detention of three aircraft and their crew at Jask while en route to India. Folios 2-4 refer to the detention and subsequent release ofan aircraft with two crew and four passengers at Chahbar (Chabahar) while enroute to Afghanistan. The primary correspondents are: British High Commission,Karachi; British Legation, Tehran.The file includes a divider, which gives a list ofcorrespondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at theback of the correspondence.
